page.title: 01Portstewart Seaside Resort
page.content: Porstewart is a coastal town and seaside resort with a population in excess of 5000. It is mainly a residential town catering for holiday makers in the summer months and students for the nearby University in the winter months. It is part of the Causeway Coast with picturesque views of the barmouth where the river Baun flows into the sea, the north Derry Hills and Donegal mountains to the west. The main feature of the town is its Promenade overlooked by the present Dominican College, formerly O'Haras castle. The resort attracts tourists with its famous Strand and numerous recreational activities. In May of each year the town hosts the world known North WEst 200 motor bike race, while in June an annual evangelical Convention is held.
